register.description: IP Revision

bitfield.description: IP revision

register.description: This register allows to control various parameters of the OCP interface.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads returns 0.
Master interface power management, standby/wait control

bitenum.description: Force-standby. MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled. MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled.
No-Standby: MStandby is never asserted.
Smart-Standby. MStandby is asserted based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads returns 0
Clocks activity during wake up mode period

bitenum.description: OCP and functional clocks can be switched off.
Functional clocks can be switched off and OCP clocks are maintained during wake up period.
OCP clocks can be switched off and Functional clocks are maintained during wake up period.
OCP and functional clocks are maintained during wake-up period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads returns 0

Warm reset. Set this bit to 1 triggers a module warm reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0. The warm reset keep the configuration registers unchanged.

bitenum.description: Normal mode
The warm reset is set.

bitfield.description: Slave interface power management, Idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Force-idle. An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally.
No-idle. An idle request is never acknowledged.
Smart-idle. Acknowledgment to an idle request is given based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: WakeUp feature control

bitenum.description: Wakeup is disabled.
Wakeup is enabled.

bitfield.description: Software reset. Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Normal mode
The module is reset.

bitfield.description: Internal interface clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Interface clock is free-running.

Automatic interface L3_MAIN gating strategy is applied, based on the OCP interface activity. Automatic functional clock gating is also applied to the functional clock based on the module activity (for instance DISPC_<pipe>_ATTRIBUTES.ENABLE).

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on-going.
Reset completed

register.description: This register regroups all the status of the module internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Flip Immediate Done. The DMA engine has acknowledged the immediate BA change, and software can write the new BA0.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Synchronization lost on the third LCD output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with the third LCD output.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Write-back DMA buffer is flushed before it is completely drained.In WB capture mode, if the new frame starts before the WB DMA buffers are fully drained (onto external memory), then the contents of the WB DMA buffers are lost (implying last few pixels/lines are corrupted in the captured frame in memory). This interrupt is an indication of that case and will trigger every frame .

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged
READS: Event is true (Pending) WRITES: Status bit is reset

bitfield.description: Write-back DMA buffer overflow. The DMA buffer is full.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Frame done for the TV. The TV output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Frame done for the write-back channel. The write-back channel has output the frame. All the data of the frame have been sent to the memory. There is no pending data inside the DMA engine for the write-back channel to be transferred to memory. It is available only when the write-back pipeline transfers back to memory the output of one of the pipelines. In case of overlay capture, the interrupt is not generated and the user shall use the FrameDone for the corresponding captured output.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the primary LCD and TV outputs.

bitfield.description: Spatial/temporal dithering number of frames for the primary LCD output wr: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Spatial only
Spatial and temporal over 2 frames
Spatial and temporal over 4 frames

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
State of unused bits (TDM mode only) for the primary LCD output. wr: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Low level (0)
High level (1)
Unchanged from previous state

bitfield.description: Cycle format (TDM mode only) for the primary LCD output WR: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: 1 cycle for 1 pixel
2 cycles for 1 pixel
3 cycles for 1 pixel
3 cycles for 2 pixels

bitfield.description: Output interface width (TDM mode only) for the primary LCD output WR: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: 8-bit parallel output interface selected
9-bit parallel output interface selected
12-bit parallel output interface selected
16-bit parallel output interface selected

bitfield.description: Enable the multiple cycle format for the primary LCD output. WR: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: TDM disabled
TDM enabled

bitfield.description: Hold time for TV output WR: EVSYNC Encoded value (from 1 to 8) to specify the number of external digital clock periods to hold the data (programmed value = value minus 1)
General purpose output signal l WR: immediate

bitenum.description: The GPout1 is reset.
The GPout1 is set.

bitfield.description: General Purpose Output Signal WR:immediate

bitenum.description: The GPout0 is reset.
The GPout0 is set.

bitfield.description: General purpose input signal WR: immediately

bitenum.description: The GPin1 has been reset.
The GPin1 has been set.

bitfield.description: General purpose input signal WR: immediately

bitenum.description: The GPin0 has been reset.
The GPin0 has been set.

bitfield.description: Overlay optimization for the primary LCD output WR: VFP start period of the primary LCD

bitenum.description: All the data for all the enabled pipelines are fetched from memory regardless of the overlay/alpha blending configuration.
The data not used by the overlay manager because of overlap between layers with no alpha blending between them must not be fetched from memory in order to optimize the bandwidth.

bitfield.description: STALL mode for the primary LCD output wr: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Normal mode selected

STALL mode selected. The Display Controller sends the data without considering the VSYNC/HSYNC. The LCD output is disabled at the end of the transfer of the frame. To generate a new frame, the software must re-enable the LCD output.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the primary LCD interface WR: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: 12-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
16-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
18-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
24-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface

bitfield.description: Spatial temporal dithering enable for the primary LCD output WR: VFP start period of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Spatial/temporal dithering logic disabled
Spatial/temporal dithering logic enabled

bitfield.description: GO command for the TV output. It is used to synchronized the pipelines (graphics and/or video ones) associated with the TV output. WR: immediate

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the TV output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
The user has finished to program the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the TV output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the external VSYNC.

bitfield.description: GO command for the primary LCD output. It is used to synchronized the pipelines (graphics and/or video ones) associated with the primary LCD output. WR: immediate

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the LCD output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
The user has finished to program the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the LCD output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the VFP start period

bitfield.description: Mono 8-bit mode of the primary LCD wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output
LCD Display type of the primary LCD WR: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: STN display operation enabled. STN dither logic is enabled.
Active or TFT display operation enabled. STN Dither logic and output FIFO bypassed.

bitfield.description: Monochrome/color selection for the primary LCD WR: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Color operation enabled (STN mode only)
Monochrome operation enabled (STN mode only)

bitfield.description: Enable the TV output wr: immediate effect only occurs at the end of the current frame.

bitenum.description: TV output disabled (at the end of the current field if interlace output when the bit is reset)
TV output enabled

bitfield.description: Enable the primary LCD outputs wr: immediate Effect only occurs at the end of the current frame

bitenum.description: LCD output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset)
LCD output enabled

register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the primary LCD output and TV output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
TV Interleave Pattern
pLCD Interleave Pattern
Color Space Conversion full range setting. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Limited range selected.
Full range selected.

bitfield.description: Enable the color space conversion. It shall be reset when CPR bit field is set to 0x1. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Disable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV
Enable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV

bitfield.description: Selects the first field to output in case of interlace mode. In case of progressive mode, the value is not used. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: First field is even.
Odd field is first.

bitfield.description: Selects between progressive and interlace mode for the primary LCD output. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Progressive mode selected.
Interlace mode selected.

bitfield.description: Selects BT.1120 format on the primary LCD output. It is not posssible to enable BT.656 and BT.1120 at the same time one the same LCD output. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: BT.1120 is disabled
BT.1120 is enabled.

bitfield.description: Selects BT.656 format on the primary LCD output. It is not posssible to enable BT.656 and BT.1120 at the same time one the same LCD output. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: BT.656 is disabled.
BT.656 is enabled.

bitfield.description: Selects the alpha blender overlay manager for the TV output instead of the color key alpha blender (LCD output). The bit field is deprecated. It is present for software backward compatibility only. When it is enabled, the Z-order defined in each ATTRIBUTES registers for only the pipelines associated pipeline connected to the TV output are invalid and replaced by the following: graphics z-order = 3, video3 z-order = 2, video2 z-order =1 and video1 z-order=0 If it disabled, the z-order and z-order enable bit fields defined in each ATTRIBUTES register are used. wr: EVSYNC start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Alpha blender is disabled.
The alpha blender is enabled.

bitfield.description: Selects the alpha blender overlay manager for the primary LCD output instead of the color key alpha blender (LCD output). The bit field is deprecated. It is present for software backward compatibility only. When it is enabled, the Z-order defined in each ATTRIBUTES registers for only the pipelines associated with the primary LCD output are invalid and replaced by the following: graphics z-order = 3, video3 z-order = 2, video2 z-order =1 and video1 z-order=0 If it disabled, the z-order and z-order enable bit fields defined in each ATTRIBUTES register are used. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: Alpha blender is disabled. The color key alpha blending is used.
The alpha blender is enabled.

bitfield.description: Controls if the DMA buffers are refilled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all DMA buffers are refilled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Each DMA buffer is refilled when it reaches LOW threshold.

All DMA buffers are refilled up to high threshold when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. (only active DMA buffers shall be considered and when reaching the end of the frame the DMA buffer goes to empty condition so no need to fill it again).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Color phase rotation control (primary LCD output). It shall be reset when ColorConvEnable bit field is set to 1 wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Color Phase Rotation Disabled
Color Phase Rotation Enabled

bitfield.description: Buffer merge control wr: EVSYNC or whenDISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory or VFP When enabled, the DISPC_GLOBAL_BUFFER register is ignored. This bit must be set to zero when the write back channel is used. When DISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is used BUFFERMERGE MUST be zero. When DISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is used BUFFERMERGE MUST be zero. WR: immediate

bitenum.description: DMA buffer merge disabled Each DMA buffer is dedicated to one pipeline.
DMA buffer merge enabled All the DMA buffers are merged into a single one to be used by the single active pipeline.

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (TV output) wr: EVSYNC

bitenum.description: Destination transparency color key selected
Source transparency color key selected

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (TV output) WR: EVSYNC

bitenum.description: Disable the transparency color key for the TV output
Enable the transparency color key for the TV output

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (primary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Destination transparency color key selected
Source transparency color key selected

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (primary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Disable the transparency color key for the LCD
Enable the transparency color key for the LCD

bitenum.description: Gamma table LCD2 and TV are bypassed
Gamma table LCD2 and TV are enabled

AcBias gated enabled

VSYNC gated enabled

HSYNC gated enabled

bitfield.description: Pixel Clock Gated Enabled (primary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel clock gated disabled
Pixel clock gated enabled

bitfield.description: Pixel data gated enabled (primary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel data gated disabled
Pixel data gated enabled

bitfield.description: Palette/gamma table selection wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output or VFP start period of secondary LCD output or EVSYNC or whenDISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the graphics pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory. In case of the table is used as gamma table, it is used for the primary LCD output only.NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats are not supported in this family of devices. .

bitenum.description: LUT used as palette (only if graphics format is BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8)
LUT used as gamma table (only if graphics format is NOT BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8 or no graphics window present)

bitfield.description: Loading mode for the palette/gamma table wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output or VFP start period of secondary LCD output or EVSYNC or whenDISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitenum.description: Palette/Gamma Table and data are loaded every frame
Palette/Gamma Table to be loaded. The user sets the bit when the palette/gamma table has to be loaded. Hardware resets the bit to 0x2 when table has been loaded. (.ENABLE has to be set to 1).
Frame data only loaded every frame
Palette/Gamma Table and frame data loaded on first frame then switch to 0x2 (Hardware).

bitfield.description: Pixel gated enable (only for TFT) (primary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of primary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel clock always toggles (only in TFT mode)
Pixel clock only toggles when there is valid data to display. (only in TFT mode)

register.description: The control register allows to configure the default solid background color for the primary LCD. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the primary LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
24-bit RGB color value to specify the default solid color to display when there is no data from the overlays.

register.description: The control register allows to configure the default solid background color for the TV output. Shadow register, updated on EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
24-bit RGB color value to specify the default solid color to display when there is no data from the overlays.

register.description: The register sets the transparency color value for the video/graphics overlays for the primary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the primary LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Transparency color key value in RGB format [0] BITMAP 1 (CLUT), [23,1] set to 0s [1:0] BITMAP 2 (CLUT), [23,2] set to 0s [3:0] BITMAP 4 (CLUT), [23,4] set to 0s [7:0] BITMAP 8 (CLUT), [23,8] set to 0s [11:0] RGB 12, [23,12] set to 0s [15:0] RGB 16, [23,16] set to 0s [23:0] RGB 24NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats are not supported in this family of devices. .

register.description: The register sets the transparency color value for the video/graphics overlays for the TV output. Shadow register, updated on EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Transparency color key value in RGB format [0] BITMAP 1 (CLUT), [23,1] set to 0s [1:0] BITMAP 2 (CLUT), [23,2] set to 0s [3:0] BITMAP 4 (CLUT), [23,4] set to 0s [7:0] BITMAP 8 (CLUT), [23,8] set to 0s [11:0] RGB 12, [23,12] set to 0s [15:0] RGB 16, [23,16] set to 0s [23:0] RGB 24NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats are not supported in this family of devices. .

register.description: The control register indicates the current primary LCD panel display line number.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Current LCD panel line number Current display line number. The first active line has the value 0. During blanking lines the line number is not incremented.

register.description: The control register indicates the primary LCD panel display line number for the interrupt and the DMA request. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
LCD panel line number programming LCD line number defines the line on which the programmable interrupt is generated and the DMA request occurs.

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal. It is used for the primary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD

bitfield.description: Horizontal Back Porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display (program to value minus 1). When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 2 for Even Field.

Horizontal front porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted (program to value minus 1). When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 1 for Even Field.

Horizontal synchronization pulse width. Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line (program to value minus 1). When in BT mode, this field corresponds to the horizontal blanking

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal. It is used for the primary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD

bitfield.description: Vertical back porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame.
Vertical front porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame.

Vertical synchronization pulse width. In active mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods (program to value minus 1) to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode.

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration. It is used for the primary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Defines the alignment between HSYNC and VSYNC assertion.

bitenum.description: VSYNC and HSYNC are not aligned
VSYNC and HSYNC assertions are aligned.

bitfield.description: HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/OffNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[22]DSS_CH0_ON_OFF must be set to match enum=DBit16 .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of pixel clock than pixel data
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16

bitfield.description: Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or FallNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[16]DSS_CH0_RF must be set to match enum=DRiEdPCk .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on falling edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on rising edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)

bitfield.description: Invert output enable

bitenum.description: Ac-bias is active high (active display mode)
Ac-bias is active low (active display mode)

bitfield.description: Invert pixel clockNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[19]DSS_CH0_IPC must be set to match enum=DfPCk .

bitenum.description: Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the rising-edge of the pixel clock
Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the falling-edge of the pixel clock

bitfield.description: Invert HSYNC

bitenum.description: Line clock pin is active high and inactive low
Line clock pin is active low and inactive high

bitfield.description: Invert VSYNC

bitenum.description: Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low
Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high

bitfield.description: AC Bias pin transitions per interrupt Value (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC Bias pin transitions

AC Bias pin frequency value (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the AC Bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge build-up within the display.

register.description: The register configures the divisors. It is used for the primary LCD output Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Display controller logic clock divisor value (from 1 to 255) to specify the intermediate pixel clock frequency based on the LCD1_CLK. The value 0 is invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Pixel clock divisor value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the pixel clock based on the LCD1_CLK divided byDISPC_DIVISOR1.LCD value. The values 0 is invalid.

register.description: The register defines the global alpha value for the graphics and three video pipelines. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory for each bit field depending on the association of the each pipeline with the primary LCD, secondary LCD or TV output.

bitfield.description: Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. 0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque.

register.description: The register configures the size of the TV output field (interlace), frame (progressive) (horizontal and vertical). Shadow register, updated on EVSYNC. A delta value is used to indicate if the odd field has same vertical size as the even field or +/- one line.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Lines per panel encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines per panel.
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field

bitenum.description: Same size
Odd size = Even size +1
Odd size = Even Size –1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Pixels per line encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display.

register.description: The register configures the panel size (horizontal and vertical). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD. A delta value is used to indicate if the odd field has same vertical size as the even field or +/- one line.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Lines per panel encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus 1).
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field

bitenum.description: Same size
Odd size = Even size +1
Odd size = Even Size -1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Pixels per line encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display (program to value minus 1). In STALL mode, any value is valid. In non STALL mode, only values multiple of 8 pixels are valid.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the graphics buffer displayed in the graphics window (0 and 1 :for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity, 0 only used when graphics pipeline on the LCD output and 0 and 1 when on the TV output). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Graphics base address Base address of the graphics buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary) (in case 1-, 2-, and 4-bpp, byte alignment is required, in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required) When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the graphics buffer displayed in the graphics window (0 and 1 :for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity, 0 only used when graphics pipeline on the LCD output and 0 and 1 when on the TV output). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Graphics base address Base address of the graphics buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary) (in case 1-, 2-, and 4-bpp, byte alignment is required, in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required) When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the position of the graphics window. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Y position of the graphics window. Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the graphics window on the screen. The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
X position of the graphics window. Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the graphics window on the screen. The first pixel on the left of the screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of the graphics window. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of lines of the graphics window. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the graphics window (program to value minus 1).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of pixels of the graphics window. Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels per line of the graphics window (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the graphics attributes. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: It is not used if CHANNELOUT is set to TV. Reserved when CHANNELOUT = 1 (should set to zero) wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Primary LCD output selected.
Secondary LCD output selected.
Third LCD output selected.
Write-back output to the memory selected.

bitfield.description: The type of burst can be INCR (incremental) or BLCK (2D block). The 2D block is required when the TILER is targeted by the DMA engine. (It does not apply to the palette loading OCP requests using INCR burst only)

bitenum.description: INC burst type is used.
2D block burst type is used.

bitfield.description: The field configures the DISPC GFX to process incoming data as premultiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. Default setting is non premultiplied alpha data.

bitenum.description: Non premultiplyalpha data color component
Premultiplyalpha data color component

bitfield.description: Z-Order defining the priority of the layer compared to others when overlaying. It is software responsibility to ensure that each layer connected to the same overlay manager has a different z-order value. If bit 25 is set to 0, the ZORDER bit field is ignored and replaced by the value 0.

bitenum.description: Z-order 0: layer above solid background color and below layer with higher Z-order values.
Z-order 1: layer above layer with z-order value of 0 and below layers with z-order values of 2 and 3
Z-order 3: layer above all the other layers
Z-order 2: layer above layers with z-order value of 0 and 1 and below layer with z-order value of 3

bitfield.description: Z-order Enable. The bit field ZORDER is only used when the Z-order is enabled.

bitenum.description: Z-order disabled. The Z-order of the layer is 0.
Z-order enabled. The Z-order is defined by the bit field ZORDER (bits 26 and 27).

bitfield.description: Antiflicker filtering using a 3-tap filter with hardcoded coefficients (1/4, 1/2, 1/4)

bitenum.description: Antiflicker disabled.
Antiflicker enabled.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Subsampling pattern setting.
Automatic self-refresh mode

bitenum.description: The transition from Selfrefresh disabled to enabled is controlled by software
The transition from Selfrefresh disabled to enabled is controlled only by hardware

bitfield.description: Force TILED regions access to 1D or 2D.

bitenum.description: 2D accesses for tiled regions
1D accesses for tiled regions

bitfield.description: Enables the self refresh of the graphics window from its own DMA buffer. This bit should be set only after having set the GO bit of the channel and read back a zero in its field.

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory.
The graphics pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the graphics DMA buffer is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the DMA buffer.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the graphics pipeline. When the graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipelines. The arbitration wheel gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Graphics rotation flag

bitenum.description: No rotation
Rotation by 90 degrees
Rotation by 270 degrees
Rotation by 180 degrees

bitfield.description: Graphics preload value

bitenum.description: Hardware prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register
Hardware prefetches pixels up to high threshold value

bitfield.description: Frame packing mode control.

bitenum.description: Frame Packing mode is disabled
Frame Packing mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Graphics nibble mode (only for 1-, 2- and 4 bpp)NOTE: BITMAP formats and associated Nibble Mode are not supported in this family of devices. .

bitenum.description: Nibble mode is disabled
Nibble mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Graphics Channel Out configuration: LCD, WB or TV. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: LCD output or WB to the memory selected. bit fields 31 and 30 defines the output associated (primary, secondary or write-back).
TV output selected

bitfield.description: Graphics DMA burst size

bitenum.description: 2 × 128-bit bursts
4 × 128-bit bursts
8 × 128-bit bursts

bitfield.description: Graphics replication enabled: RGB . ARGB, and RGBA formats are converted into ARGB32-8888 using replication of the MSBs or 0s

bitenum.description: Disable graphics replication logic. The conversion to ARGB32-8888 is done by adding 0s for the LSBs
Enable graphics replication logic. The conversion to ARGB32-8888 is done by duplicating the MSBs for the LSBs

bitfield.description: Graphics format. It defines the pixel format when fetching the graphics picture into memory.

bitenum.description: xRGB24-8888 (32-bit container)
RGB24-888 (24-bit container)
RGBx24-8888 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: Graphics enable

bitenum.description: Graphics disabled (graphics pipeline inactive and graphics window not present)
Graphics enabled (graphics pipeline active and graphics window present on the screen)

register.description: The register configures the graphics buffer. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: DMA buffer high threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value
DMA buffer low threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value. The value put in this register must always be greater than zero.

register.description: The register defines the Graphics buffer size

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
DMA buffer size in number of 128 bits

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded unsigned value to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the graphics buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1- (n+1)*bpp means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels. For more information, see, Predecimation. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of bytes to increment between two pixels. Encoded unsigned value (from 1 to 255) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the graphics buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1+n*bpp means increment of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the palette buffer or the gamma table buffer. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory. NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats, and associated palette buffer, are not supported in this family of devices.

bitfield.description: Base address of the palette/gamma table buffer (24-bit entries in 32-bit containers, aligned on 32-bit boundary).NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats, and associated palette buffer, are not supported in this family of devices. .

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 1 (DISPC_VID1_BA_0 and DISPC_VID1_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID1_BA_0 is used). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2:0, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 1 (DISPC_VID1_BA_0 and DISPC_VID1_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID1_BA_0 is used). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2:0, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the position of the video window 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

Number of lines of the video 1 Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the video window 1. Program to value minus 1.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of pixels of the video window 1 Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video window 1. Program to value minus 1.

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the video window 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: It is not used if CHANNELOUT is set to TV. Reserved when CHANNELOUT = 1 (should be set to zero) wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Primary LCD output selected.
Secondary LCD output selected.
Third LCD output selected.
Write-back output to the memory selected.

bitfield.description: The type of burst can be INCR (incremental) or BLCK (2D block). The 2D block is required when the TILER is targeted by the DMA engine.

bitenum.description: INC burst type is used.
2D block burst type is used.

bitfield.description: The field configures the DISPC VID1 to process incoming data as premultiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. Default setting is non premultiplied alpha data.

bitenum.description: Non premultiplyalpha data color component
Premultiplyalpha data color component

bitfield.description: Z-Order defining the priority of the layer compared to others when overlaying. It is software responsibility to ensure that each layer connected to the same overlay manager has a different z-order value. If bit 25 is set to 0, the ZORDER bit field is ignored and replaced by the value 0.

bitenum.description: Z-order 0: layer above solid background color and below layer with higher Z-order values.
Z-order 1: layer above layer with z-order value of 0 and below layers with z-order values of 2 and 3
Z-order 3: layer above all the other layers
Z-order 2: layer above layers with z-order value of 0 and 1 and below layer with z-order value of 3

bitfield.description: Z-order Enable. The bit field ZORDER is only used when the Z-order is enabled.

bitenum.description: Z-order disabled. The Z-order of the layer is 0.
Z-order enabled. The Z-order is defined by the bit field ZORDER (bits 26 and 27).

bitfield.description: Enables the self refresh of the video window from its own DMA buffer only.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory.
The video pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the DMA buffer associated with the video1 is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the DMA buffer.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the video pipeline. The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Determines if the stride for CbCr buffer is the 1x or 2x of the Y buffer stride. It is only used in case of YUV4:2:0.

bitenum.description: The CbCr stride value is equal to the Y stride.
The CbCr stride value is double to the Y stride.

bitfield.description: Video vertical resize tap number. The vertical polyphase filter can be configured in 3-tap or 5-tap configuration. According to the number of taps, the maximum input picture width is double while using 3-tap compared to 5-tap.

bitenum.description: 3 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The 2 other taps are not used. The associated bit fields for the 2 other taps coefficients do not need to be initialized.
5 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic.

bitfield.description: Force TILED regions access to 1D or 2D.

bitenum.description: 2D accesses for tiled regions
1D accesses for tiled regions

bitfield.description: Video Preload Value

bitenum.description: Hardware prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register
Hardware prefetches pixels up to high threshold value

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Automatic self-refresh mode

bitenum.description: The transition from SELFREFRESH disabled to enabled is controlled by SW.
The transition from SELFREFRESH disabled to enabled is controlled only by hardware.

bitfield.description: Video channel out configuration: LCD, WB or TV. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: LCD output or WB to the memory selected. bit fields 31 and 30 defines the output associated (primary, secondary or write-back).
TV output selected

bitfield.description: Video DMA burst size

bitenum.description: 2x128bit bursts
4x128bit bursts
8x128bit bursts

bitfield.description: Video rotation flag

bitenum.description: No rotation
Rotation by 90 degrees
Rotation by 270 degrees
Rotation by 180 degrees

bitfield.description: Color space conversion full range setting.

bitenum.description: Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion
Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion

bitfield.description: Replication enable

bitenum.description: Disable Video replication logic
Enable Video replication logic

bitfield.description: Enable the color space conversion. The hardware does not enable/disable the conversion based on the pixel format. The bit field shall be reset when the format is not YUV.

bitenum.description: Disable Color Space Conversion YUV to RGB
Enable Color Space Conversion YUV to RGB

bitfield.description: Frame packing mode control.

bitenum.description: Frame Packing mode is disabled
Frame Packing mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Video Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Disable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the horizontal resize processing
Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Video Format. It defines the pixel format when fetching the video 1 picture into memory.

bitenum.description: YUV2 4:2:2 co-sited
NV12 4:2:0 2 buffers (Y + UV)
xRGB24-8888 (32-bit container)
RGB24-888 (24-bit container)
UYVY 4:2:2 co-sited
RGBx24-8888 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: Video Enable

bitenum.description: Video disabled (video pipeline inactive and window not present)
Video enabled (video pipeline active and window present on the screen)

register.description: The register configures the video buffer associated with the video pipeline 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video DMA buffer high threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value
DMA buffer low threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value

register.description: The register defines the Video buffer size for the video pipeline 1.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Video 1 DMA buffer size in number of 128-bits

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with the video window 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from 21 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1 (n + 1)* bpp means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with the video window 2. For more information, see, Predecimation.The register is used only when the TILER is not present in the system in order to perform low performance rotation. When the TILER IP is present it is highly recommended to use it for performing the rotation. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD orEVSYNC or when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of bytes to increment between two pixels. Encoded unsigned value (from 1 to 255) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. For YUV4:2:0, maximum supported value is 128.

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 1. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with the video layer 1 before up/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD, EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of lines of the video picture. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded to 2.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit. (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded to 2.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 1 (DISPC_VID1_ACCU_0 and DISPC_VID1_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
