register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 2 (DISPC_VID2_BA_0 and DISPC_VID2_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID2_BA_0 is used)). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2:0, byte alignment is supported)). In case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 2 (DISPC_VID2_BA_0 and DISPC_VID2_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID2_BA_0 is used)). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2:0, byte alignment is supported)). In case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the position of the video window 2. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Y position of the video window 2 encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the video window 2 .The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
X position of the video window 2 encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the video window 2. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video window 2. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of lines of the video 2 encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the video window 2. Program to value minus 1.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of pixels of the video window 2 encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video window 2. Program to value minus 1.

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the video window 2. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: It is not used if CHANNELOUT is set to TV. Reserved when CHANNELOUT = 1 (must be set to zero) wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Primary LCD output selected.
Secondary LCD output selected.
Third LCD output selected.
Write-back output to the memory selected.

bitfield.description: The type of burst can be INCR (incremental) or BLCK (2D block). The 2D block is required when the TILER is targeted by the DMA engine.

bitenum.description: INC burst type is used.
2D block burst type is used.

bitfield.description: The field configures the DISPC VID2 to process incoming data as premultiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. Default setting is non premultiplied alpha data.

bitenum.description: Non premultiplyalpha data color component
Premultiplyalpha data color component

bitfield.description: Z-Order defining the priority of the layer compared to others when overlaying. It is software responsibility to ensure that each layer connected to the same overlay manager has a different z-order value. If bit 25 is set to 0, the ZORDER bit field is ignored and replaced by the value 0.

bitenum.description: Z-order 0: layer above solid background color and below layer with higher Z-order values.
Z-order 1: layer above layer with z-order value of 0 and below layers with z-order values of 2 and 3
Z-order 3: layer above all the other layers
Z-order 2: layer above layers with z-order value of 0 and 1 and below layer with z-order value of 3

bitfield.description: Z-order Enable. The bit field ZORDER is only used when the Z-order is enabled.

bitenum.description: Z-order disabled. The Z-order of the layer is 0.
Z-order enabled. The Z-order is defined by the bit field ZORDER (bits 26 and 27).

bitfield.description: Enables the self refresh of the video window from its own DMA buffer only.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory.
The video pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the DMA buffer associated with the video2 is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the DMA buffer.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the video pipeline. The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Determines if the stride for CbCr buffer is the 1x or 2x of the Y buffer stride. It is only used in case of YUV4:2:0.

bitenum.description: The CbCr stride value is equal to the Y stride.
The CbCr stride value is double to the Y stride.

bitfield.description: Video Vertical Resize Tap Number

bitenum.description: 3 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The 2 other taps are not used. The associated bit fields for the 2 other taps coefficients do not need to be initialized.
5 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic.

bitfield.description: Force TILED regions access to 1D or 2D.

bitenum.description: 2D accesses for tiled regions
1D accesses for tiled regions

bitfield.description: Video Preload Value

bitenum.description: Hardware prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register
Hardware prefetches pixels up to high threshold value

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Automatic self-refresh mode

bitenum.description: The transition from SELFREFRESH disabled to enabled is controlled by SW.
The transition from SELFREFRESH disabled to enabled is controlled only by hardware.

bitfield.description: Video Channel Out configuration: LCD, WB or TV. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: LCD output or WB to the memory selected. bit fields 31 and 30 defines the output associated (primary, secondary or write-back).
TV output selected

bitfield.description: Video DMA burst size

bitenum.description: 2 × 128-bit bursts
4 × 128-bit bursts
8 × 128-bit bursts

bitfield.description: Video Rotation Flag

bitenum.description: No rotation
Rotation by 90 degrees
Rotation by 270 degrees
Rotation by 180 degrees

bitfield.description: Color space conversion full range setting.

bitenum.description: Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion
Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion

bitfield.description: Replication Enable

bitenum.description: Disable Video replication logic
Enable Video replication logic

bitfield.description: Enable the color space conversion. The hardware does not enable/disable the conversion based on the pixel format. The bit field shall be reset when the format is not YUV.

bitenum.description: Disable color space conversion YUV to RGB
Enable color space conversion YUV to RGB

bitfield.description: Frame packing mode control.

bitenum.description: Frame Packing mode is disabled
Frame Packing mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Video Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Disable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the horizontal resize processing
Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Video Format. It defines the pixel format when fetching the video 2 picture into memory.

bitenum.description: YUV2 4:2:2 co-sited
NV12 4:2:0 2 buffers (Y + UV)
xRGB24-8888 (32-bit container)
RGB24-888 (24-bit container)
UYVY 4:2:2 co-sited
RGBx24-8888 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)
Video disabled (video pipeline inactive and window not present)
Video enabled (video pipeline active and window present on the screen)

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffer associated with the video pipeline 2. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: DMA buffer high threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value
DMA buffer low threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value

register.description: The register defines the DMA buffer size for the video pipeline 2.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
DMA buffer size in number of 128 bits

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with the video window 2. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from 21 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1 (n + 1) * bpp means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with the video window 2. For more information, see, Predecimation.The register is used only when the TILER is not present in the system in order to perform low performance rotation. When the TILER IP is present it is highly recommended to use it for performing the rotation. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of bytes to increment between two pixels. Encoded unsigned value (from 1 to 255) to specify the number of bytes between2 pixels in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. For YUV4:2:0, maximum supported value is 128.

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 2. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with the video layer 2 before up/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of lines of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the maximum size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded 2.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit. (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded 2.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 2 (DISPC_VID2_ACCU_0 and DISPC_VID2_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 2 (DISPC_VID2_ACCU_0 and DISPC_VID2_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

register.description: The bank of registers configure the up/down-scaling coefficients for the horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the video window 2 for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

Unsigned coefficient C2 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n
Signed coefficient C1 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n
Signed coefficient C0 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The bank of registers configure the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical and horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the video window 2 for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

Signed coefficient C4 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the secondary LCD output. Shadow registers are updated during the VFP start period of the secondary LCD, EVSYNC, or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and the current WB frame is complete (that is, has no more data in the write-back pipeline).

bitfield.description: Spatial/temporal dithering number of frames for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Spatial only
Spatial and temporal over 2 frames
Spatial and temporal over 4 frames

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
State of unused bits (TDM mode only) for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Low level (0)
High level (1)
Unchanged from previous state

bitfield.description: Cycle format (TDM mode only) for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: 1 cycle for 1 pixel
2 cycles for 1 pixel
3 cycles for 1 pixel
3 cycles for 2 pixels

bitfield.description: Output Interface width (TDM mode only) for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: 8-bit parallel output interface selected
9-bit parallel output interface selected
12-bit parallel output interface selected
16-bit parallel output interface selected

bitfield.description: Enable the multiple cycle format for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: TDM disabled
TDM enabled

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Overlay optimization for the TV output wr: VFP or EVSYNC or whenDISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitenum.description: All the data for all the enabled pipelines are fetched from memory regardless of the overlay/alpha blending configuration.
The data not used by the overlay manager because of overlap between layers with no alpha blending between them shall not be fetched from memory in order to optimize the bandwidth.

bitfield.description: Overlay optimization for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP or EVSYNC or whenDISPC_CONTROL2.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitenum.description: All the data for all the enabled pipelines are fetched from memory regardless of the overlay/alpha blending configuration.
The data not used by the overlay manager because of overlap between layers with no alpha blending between them shall not be fetched from memory in order to optimize the bandwidth.

bitfield.description: STALL mode for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Normal mode selected

STALL mode selected. The Display Controller sends the data without considering the VSYNC/HSYNC. The LCD output is disabled at the end of the transfer of the frame. The S/W has to re-enable the LCD output in order to generate a new frame.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of lines of the secondary LCD interface wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: 12-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
16-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
18-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
24-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface

bitfield.description: Spatial temporal dithering enable for the secondary LCD output wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Spatial/Temporal dithering logic disabled
Spatial/Temporal dithering logic enabled

bitfield.description: GO command for the write-back output. It is used to synchronized the pipelines (graphics and/or video ones) associated with the write-back output to the memory. wr:immediate

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the write-back pipeline using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
The user has finished to program the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the write-back pipeline and the hardware can update the internal registers immediately

bitfield.description: GO command for the secondary LCD output. It is used to synchronized the pipelines (graphics and/or video ones) associated with the secondary LCD output. wr:immediate

bitenum.description: The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the LCD output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed.
The user has finished to program the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the LCD output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the VFP start period

bitfield.description: Mono 8-bit mode of the secondary LCD wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output
LCD Display type of the secondary LCD wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Active or TFT display operation enabled. STN Dither logic and output FIFO bypassed.

bitfield.description: Monochrome/Color selection for the secondary LCD wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Enable the secondary LCD output wr:immediate

bitenum.description: LCD output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset)
LCD output enabled

register.description: The register configures the position of the 2nd graphics window in FramePacking mode. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when [6] GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Y position of the 2nd graphics window. Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the graphics window on the screen. The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
X position of the 2nd graphics window. Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the graphics window on the screen. The first pixel on the left of the screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the position of the 2nd video window #1 in FramePacking mode. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when [6] GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Y position of the 2nd video window #1 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the video window #1 .The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
X position of the 2nd video window #1 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the video window #1. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the position of the 2nd video window #2 in FramePacking mode. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when [6] GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Y position of the 2nd video window #2 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the video window #2 .The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
X position of the 2nd video window #2 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the video window #2. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the position of the 2nd video window #3 in FramePacking mode. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when [6] GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0

Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
X position of the 2nd video window #2 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the video window #2. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 3 (DISPC_VID3_ACCU_0 and DISPC_VID3_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for ARGB and Y setting. The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 3 (DISPC_VID3_BA_0 and DISPC_VID3_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID3_BA_0 is used)). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2:0, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for the video window 3 (DISPC_VID3_BA_0 and DISPC_VID3_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID3_BA_0 is used)). bitfield.description: It is not used if CHANNELOUT is set to TV. Reserved when CHANNELOUT = 1 (should be set to zero) wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Primary LCD output selected.
Secondary LCD output selected.
Third LCD output selected.
Write-back output to the memory selected.

bitfield.description: The type of burst can be INCR (incremental) or BLCK (2D block). The 2D block is required when the TILER is targeted by the DMA engine.

bitenum.description: INC burst type is used.
2D block burst type is used.

bitfield.description: The field configures the DISPC VID3 to process incoming data as premultiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. Default setting is non premultiplied alpha data.

bitenum.description: Non premultiplyalpha data color component
Premultiplyalpha data color component

bitfield.description: Z-Order defining the priority of the layer compared to others when overlaying. It is software responsibility to ensure that each layer connected to the same overlay manager has a different z-order value. If bit 25 is set to 0, the ZORDER bit field is ignored and replaced by the value 0.

bitenum.description: Z-order 0: layer above solid background color and below layer with higher Z-order values.
Z-order 1: layer above layer with z-order value of 0 and below layers with z-order values of 2 and 3
Z-order 3: layer above all the other layers
Z-order 2: layer above layers with z-order value of 0 and 1 and below layer with z-order value of 3

bitfield.description: Z-order Enable. The bit field ZORDER is used only when the Z-order is enabled.

bitenum.description: Z-order disabled. The Z-order of the layer is 0.
Z-order enabled. The Z-order is defined by the bit field ZORDER (bits 26 and 27).

bitfield.description: Enables the self refresh of the video window from its own DMA buffer only.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory.
The video pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the DMA buffer associated with the video3 is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the DMA buffer.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the video pipeline. The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Determines if the stride for CbCr buffer is the 1x or 2x of the Y buffer stride. It is only used in case of YUV4:2:0.

bitenum.description: The CbCr stride value is equal to the Y stride.
The CbCr stride value is double to the Y stride.

bitfield.description: Video vertical resize tap number

bitenum.description: 3 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The 2 other taps are not used. The associated bit fields for the 2 other taps coefficients do not need to be initialized.
5 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic.

bitfield.description: Force TILED regions access to 1D or 2D.

bitenum.description: 2D accesses for tiled regions
1D accesses for tiled regions

bitfield.description: Video Preload Value

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with the video layer 3 before up/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of lines of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded 2.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory (program to value minus 1). The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit. (program to value minus 1). When predecimation is set, the value represents the size of the image after predecimation but the max size of the unpredecimated image size in memory is still bounded 2.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with the video window 3. For more information, see, Predecimation.The register is used only when the TILER is not present in the system in order to perform low performance rotation. When the TILER IP is present it is highly recommended to use it for performing the rotation. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Number of bytes to increment between two pixels. Encoded unsigned value (from 1 to 255) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. For YUV4:2:0, maximum supported value is 128.

register.description: The register configures the position of the video window 3. X position of the video window 2 Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the video window 2. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with the video window 3. bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from 21 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n * bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1 (n + 1) * bpp means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video window 3. register.description: The register configures the panel size (horizontal and vertical). It is used for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD. A delta value is used to indicate if the odd field has same vertical size as the even field or +/- one line.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Lines per panel encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus 1).
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field

bitenum.description: same size
odd size = even size +1
Odd size = even size –1

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

Pixels per line encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display (program to value minus 1). In STALL mode, any value is valid. In non STALL mode, only values multiple of 8 pixels are valid.

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal. It is used for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD

bitfield.description: Horizontal back porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display (program to value minus 1).
Horizontal front porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted (program to value minus 1).
Horizontal synchronization pulse width. Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal. It is used for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD

bitfield.description: Vertical back porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame before the first set of pixels is output to the display.
Vertical front porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame.

Vertical synchronization pulse width. In active mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods (program to value minus 1) to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode.

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration. It is used for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Defines the alignment between HSYNC and VSYNC assertion.

bitenum.description: VSYNC and HSYNC are not aligned.
VSYNC and HSYNC assertions are aligned.

bitfield.description: HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/OffNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[23]DSS_CH1_ON_OFF must be set to match enum=DBit16 .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of pixel clock than pixel data.
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16.

bitfield.description: Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or FallNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[17]DSS_CH1_RF must be set to match enum=DRiEdPCk .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on falling edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1).
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on rising edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1).

bitfield.description: Invert output enable

bitenum.description: Ac-bias is active high (active display mode).
Ac-bias is active low (active display mode).

bitfield.description: Invert pixel clockNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[20]DSS_CH1_IPC must be set to match enum=DfPCk .

bitenum.description: Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the rising-edge of the pixel clock.
Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the falling-edge of the pixel clock.

bitfield.description: Invert HSYNC

bitenum.description: Line clock pin is active high and inactive low.
Line clock pin is active low and inactive high.

bitfield.description: Invert VSYNC

bitenum.description: Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low.
Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high.

bitfield.description: AC Bias Pin transitions per interrupt Value (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC Bias pin transitions

AC Bias Pin Frequency Value (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the AC Bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge build-up within the display.

register.description: The register configures the divisors. It is used for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Display controller logic clock divisor value (from 1 to 255) to specify the intermediate pixel clock frequency based on the LCD2_CLK. The value 0 is invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Pixel clock divisor value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the pixel clock based on the LCD2_CLK divided byDISPC_DIVISOR2.LCD value. The value 0 is invalid.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the write back pipeline (DISPC_WB_ACCU_0 and DISPC_WB_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accumulator value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the write back pipeline (DISPC_WB_ACCU_0 and DISPC_WB_ACCU_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accumulator value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accumulator value encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the base address of the WB buffer (DISPC_WB_BA_0 and DISPC_WB_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_WB_BA_0 is used). Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write-back base address Base address of the WB buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2;0, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the WB buffer (DISPC_WB_BA_0 and DISPC_WB_BA_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_WB_BA_0 is used). Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write-back base address Base address of the WB buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV4:2:2, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV4:2;0, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The bank of registers configure the up/down-scaling coefficients for the horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the write back pipeline for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Signed coefficient C3 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n
Unsigned coefficient C2 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n
Signed coefficient C1 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n
Signed coefficient C0 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The bank of registers configure the up/down-scaling coefficients for the horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the write back pipeline for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Signed coefficient C3 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the viwrite back pipeline. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Determines the number of idles between requests on the L3_MAIN interconnect. It is only used when the write-back pipeline does data transfer from memory to memory. When the output of an overlay is stored in memory through the write-back pipeline in capture mode, the bit field IDLENUMBER is ignored since a timing generator is used to time the transfer. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBER (from 0 to 15) if IDLESIZE = 0. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx8 (from 0 to 120) if IDLESIZE = 1 and BURSTSIZE = 2. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx4 (from 0 to 60) if IDLESIZE = 1 and BURSTSIZE = 1. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx2 (from 0 to 30) if IDLESIZE = 1 and BURSTSIZE = 0.
Determines if the IDLENUMBER corresponds to a number of bursts or singles.

bitenum.description: The number of idles between requests is defined by IDLENUMBER as number of cycles.
The number of idles between requests is defined by IDLENUMBER multiplied by burst size as number of cycles.

bitfield.description: Defines the frame rate capture.

bitenum.description: Only one out of six frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
Only one frame is captured.
Only one out of seven frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
All frames are captures until the write-back channel is disabled or there is no more data generated by the overlay or the pipeline attached to the write-back channel.
Only one out of two frames is captured. The first one is captured, and then the second one is skipped, and so on.
Only one out of four frames is captured. The first one is captured, and then the second one is skipped, and so on.
Only one out of five frames is captured. The first one is captured, and then the second one is skipped, and so on.
Only one out of three frames is captured. The first one is captured, and then the second one is skipped, and so on.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the write-back pipeline. The write-back pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The write-back pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The write-back pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Determines if the stride for CbCr buffer is the 1x or 2x of the Y buffer stride. It is only used in case of YUV4:2:0.

bitenum.description: The CbCr stride value is equal to the Y stride.
The CbCr stride value is double to the Y stride.

bitfield.description: Video Vertical Resize Tap Number

bitenum.description: 3 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The 2 other taps are not used.
5 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic.

bitfield.description: Force TILED regions access to 1D or 2D.

bitenum.description: 2D accesses for tiled regions
1D accesses for tiled regions

bitfield.description: When connected to the overlay output of a channel the write back can operate as a simple transfer from memory to memory (composition engine) or as a capture channel. 0x0: Capture mode (default mode) 0x1: Memory-to-memory mode
Video Channel In configuration WR: immediate

bitenum.description: Video3 pipeline output
Secondary LCD output
Primary LCD overlay output
TV overlay output
Video1 pipeline output
Video2 pipeline output
Graphics pipeline output
Third LCD output

bitfield.description: Write-back DMA Burst Size

bitenum.description: 2 × 128-bit bursts
4 × 128-bit bursts
8 × 128-bit bursts

bitfield.description: Reserved . . . .
Color Space Conversion full range setting.

bitenum.description: Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion
Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion

bitfield.description: It applies only when the input format to the write-back pipeline from the overlay or directly from one of the pipelines is ARGB32. If the format is one of the YUV supported formats, the bit field is ignored.

bitenum.description: Disable truncation logic
Enable truncation logic from ARGB32 to the pixel format defined in the field FORMAT.

bitfield.description: Enable the color space conversion. The hardware does not enable/disable the conversion based on the pixel format. The bit field shall be reset when the format is not YUV.

bitenum.description: Disable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV
Enable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV

bitfield.description: The type of burst can be INCR (incremental) or BLCK (2D block). The 2D block is required when the TILER is targeted by the DMA engine.

bitenum.description: INC burst type is used.
2D block burst type is used.

bitfield.description: Premultiplied alpha enable Read 0x1: Enabled Read 0x0: Disabled. This bit also disable the logic present in the associated channel out that compute the alpha component sent to the WB pipe. When the WB is configured to copy back one of the output channels (output of overlay), the following configurations are available: 0x1: The WB pipe copies back to memory the premultiplied alpha calculated through the overlay. 0x0: The alpha value is not written back.
Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Disable the resize processing
Enable the horizontal resize processing
Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Write-back format. It defines the pixel format when storing the write-back picture into memory.

bitenum.description: YUV2 4:2:2 co-sited
NV12 4:2:0 2 buffers (Y + UV)
xRGB24-8888 (32-bit container)
RGB24-888 (24-bit container)
UYVY 4:2:2 co-sited
RGBx24-8888 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: Write-back enable. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Write-back disabled
Write-back enabled

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for the write back pipeline (YUV4:4:4 to RGB24). Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
YG coefficient encoded signed value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
YR coefficient encoded signed value (from –1024 to 1023).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
CrR coefficient encoded signed value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
YB coefficient encoded signed value (from –1024 to 1023).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
DMA buffer Size in number of 128 bits

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffer associated with the write-back pipeline. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. bitfield.description: DMA buffer high threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value
DMA buffer low threshold number of 128 bits defining the threshold value

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the write back pipeline. It is used for ARGB and Y setting. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the size of the write-back picture associated with the write back pipeline after up/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of lines of the wb picture in memory. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the picture in memory (program to value minus 1).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of pixels of the wb picture in memory. Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the picture in memory (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with the write back pipeline. The register is used only when the TILER is not present in the system in order to perform low performance rotation. When the TILER IP is present it is highly recommended to use it for performing the rotation. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Values other than 1 are invalid

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with the vwrite back pipeline. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from 21 to 2) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. The value 0 is invalid. The value 1 means next pixel. The value 1 + n *bpp means increment of n pixels. The value 1 (n + 1) * bpp means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the size of the output of overlay connected to the write-back pipeline when the overlay output is only used by the write-back pipeline. When the overlay is output on the primary LCD or secondary LCD or TV outputs, the size of the frame is defined in the, , and respectively. Shadow register, updated when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of lines of the Write-back picture Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the write-back picture from overlay or pipeline. Program to value minus 1.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Number of pixels of the Write-back picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the write-back picture from overlay or pipeline. Program to value minus 1.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for the video window 1. (DISPC_VID1_BA_UV_0 and DISPC_VID1_BA_UV_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_VID1_BA_UV_0 is used)). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Video base address aligned on 16-bit boundary Base address of the UV video buffer used only in case of YUV4:2:0-NV12 When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for the video window 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). register.description: The control register configures the Display Controller module for the secondary LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Selects the first field to output in case of interlace mode. In case of progressive mode, the value is not used.

bitenum.description: First field is even.
Odd field is first.

bitfield.description: Selects between progressive and interlace mode for the secondary LCD output.

bitenum.description: Progressive mode selected.
Interlace mode selected.

bitfield.description: Selects BT.1120 format on the primary LCD output. It is not posssible to enable BT.656 and BT.1120 at the same time one the same LCD output. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: BT.1120 is disabled
BT.1120 is enabled.

bitfield.description: Selects BT.656 format on the primary LCD output. It is not posssible to enable BT.656 and BT.1120 at the same time one the same LCD output. wr: VFP start of primary LCD

bitenum.description: BT.656 is disabled.
BT.656 is enabled.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Color Phase Rotation Control secondary LCD output). It shall be reset when ColorConvEnable bit field is set to 1. wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Color phase rotation disabled
Color phase rotation enabled

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Transparency color key selection (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Destination transparency color key selected
Source transparency color key selected

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Disable the transparency color key for the LCD
Enable the transparency color key for the LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
ACBias gated enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: AcBias gated disabled
AcBias gated enabled

bitfield.description: VSYNC gated enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: VSYNC gated disabled
VSYNC gated enabled

bitfield.description: HSYNC gated enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: HSYNC gated disabled
HSYNC gated enabled

bitfield.description: Pixel clock gated enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel clock gated disabled
Pixel clock gated enabled

bitfield.description: Pixel data gated enabled (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel data gated disabled
Pixel data gated enabled

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Pixel gated enable (only for active matrix) (secondary LCD output) wr: VFP start period of secondary LCD output

bitenum.description: Pixel clock always toggles (only in active matrix mode).
Pixel clock only toggles when there is valid data to display (only in active matrix mode).

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the video window 1. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Subsampling pattern setting.

The YUV chrominance can be resampled using averaging of the adjacent chrominance samples, without using the polyphase filter for 4:2:2 input or can be calculated using the polyphase filter for 4:2:2/4:2:0. The polyphase filter is mandatory for the 4:2:0 format. This bit controls the order in which the processing is done on the video pipe.

bitenum.description: When input is 4:2:2, the missing chrominance samples are calculated by averaging the adjacent samples if. ROTATION=0 only. Other rotation configurations are not supported.

For 4:2:2 (or 4:2:0), the missing chrominance samples are calculated by filtering the adjacent samples (5-tap polyphase filter). See, Configuration 2: Video Pipeline. All rotation configurations are supported.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Defines the VC-1 range value for the CbCr component from 0 to 7.
Defines the VC-1 range value for the Y component from 0 to 7.
Enable/disable the VC-1 range mapping processing. The bit field is ignored if the format is not one of the supported YUV formats.

bitenum.description: VC-1 range mapping disabled
VC-1 range mapping enabled
