register.description: The register configures the look up table used as color look up table for BITMAP formats (1-, 2-, 4, and 8-bpp) on the graphics pipeline or as gamma table on the primary LCD output. NOTE: CLUT and BITMAP formats are not supported in this family of devices.

bitfield.description: Defines the location in the table where the bit field VALUE is stored.
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX

register.description: The register configures the gamma table on the secondary LCD output.

bitfield.description: Defines the location in the table where the bit field VALUE is stored.
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX
8-bit value used to defined the value to store at the location in the table defined by the bit field INDEX

register.description: The register configures the gamma table on the TV output.

bitfield.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets the internal index counter to zero. Each subsequent access to the register (with the INDEX bit kept at 0) increments the address for the next storage location into the table memory.
10-bit color component value to store in the table
10-bit color component value to store in the table
10-bit color component value to store in the table

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 1. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 1 (DISPC_VID1_ACCU2_0 and DISPC_VID1_ACCU2_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) It is used for Cb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accu value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accu value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). Signed coefficient C4 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The bank of registers configure the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical and horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the video window 1 for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 2. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 2 (DISPC_VID2_ACCU2_0 and DISPC_VID2_ACCU2_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for Cb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). Signed coefficient C4 for the horizontal up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: The bank of registers configure the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical and horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the video window 2 for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the video window 3 (DISPC_VID3_ACCU2_0 and DISPC_VID3_ACCU2_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for Cb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

register.description: The bank of registers configure the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical and horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the video window 3 for the phases from 0 to 7. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of primary LCD or VFP start period of the secondary LCD or VFP start period of the third LCD or EVSYNC or when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline). The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, third LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the write-back pipeline. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal increment of the up/downsampling filter for Cb and Cr. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). The value 0 is invalid. The values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up/downsampling of the write back pipeline (DISPC_WB_ACCU2_0 and DISPC_WB_ACCU2_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity). It is used for Cb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the hardware, any value can be used for the bit fields. Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Vertical initialization accu value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Horizontal initialization accu value Encoded value (from –1024 to 1023).

Shadow register, updated when.GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffers allocations to the pipeline (graphics, video1, video2, video3 and write-back). Both TOP and BOTTOM must be allocated to the same pipeline.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Write-back DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to write-back pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the graphics pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.

bitfield.description: Video3 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to video3 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the graphics pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.

bitfield.description: Video2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to video2 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the graphics pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.

register.description: The register configures the divisor value for generating the core functional clock. There is a backward compatibility mode enabled by default in order to use.LCD value instead of .LCD bit field for generating the core functional clock.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Display Controller Logic Clock Divisor Value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the Display Controller logic clock based on the function clock. The value 0 is invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
When the bit field is set to 1, the bit field LCD is used to generated the core functional clock from the input clock. When the bit field is set to 0, the valueDISPC_DIVISOR1.LCD is used instead.

bitenum.description: .LCD bit field is used
.LCD bit field is used

register.description: The register set the counter to control the delay to flush the WB pipe after the end of the frame in capture mode. Shadow register, updated when .GOWB is set to 1 by software and current WB frame is finished (no more data in the write-back pipeline), when the WB pipeline is directly connected to one of the pipelines (graphics or video), combined with the synchronization event of the channel overlay output selected as an input to the WB pipeline (that is, VFP start period of primary LCD, or VFP start period of secondary LCD, or VFP start period of the third LCD, or EVSYNC), for all registers associated with the selected channel out and further delayed by the .WBDELAYCOUNT bit-field, for all registers of the Write back and DMA. In WB capture mode, both .GOWB and DISPC_CONTROL#.GOLCD/TV corresponding to the selected output channel shall be set. It is not required to set the GOWB bit when WB memory-to-memory mode is used.

bitfield.description: Delays the WB pipe flush after the end of the frame. Delay = n (number of lines), where n = 0:255. If n = 0, the WB is re-initialized just at the end of the last line of a frame at the beginning of the VFP signal. If n = 1:255, the write buffers DMA are flushed n lines later.

register.description: The register configures the panel size (horizontal and vertical). It is used for the third LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the third LCD. A delta value is used to indicate if the odd field is the same vertical size as the even field or ± one line.

bitfield.description: Lines per panel Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus 1).
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field

bitenum.description: Same size
Odd size = even size +1
Odd size = even size –1

bitfield.description: Pixels per line Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels contained within each line on the display (program to value minus 1). In STALL mode, any value is valid. In non-STALL mode, only values of multiples of 8 pixels are valiid.

register.description: The register configures the divisors. It is used for the third LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the third LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Display controller logic clock divisor Value (from 1 to 255) to specify the intermediate pixel clock frequency based on LCD2_CLK. The value 0 is invalid.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Pixel clock divisor Value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the pixel clock based on LCD2_CLK divided by the value of DISPC_DIVISOR2.LCD. The value 0 is invalid.

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration. It is used for the third LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the third LCD

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return 0.
Defines the alignment betwwen HSYNC and VSYNC assertion

bitenum.description: VSYNC and HSYNC are not aligned.
VSYNC and HSYNC assertions are aligned.

bitfield.description: HSYNC/VSYNC pixel clock control on/offNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[24] DSS_CH2_ON_OFF must be set to match enum=DBit16 .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of the pixel clock than pixel data.
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16.

bitfield.description: Program HSYNC/VSYNC rise or fallNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[18] DSS_CH2_RF must be set to match enum=DRiEdPCk .

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on the falling edge of the pixel clock (if bit 17 is set to 1).
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven onthe rising edge of the pixel clock (if bit 17 is set to 1).

bitfield.description: Invert output enable

bitenum.description: Ac-bias is active high (active display mode).
Ac-bias is active low (active display mode).

bitfield.description: Invert pixel clockNote: Control module register CTRL_CORE_SMA_SW_1[21] DSS_CH2_IPC must be set to match enum=DfPCk .

bitenum.description: Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the rising edge of the pixel clock.
Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the falling edge of the pixel clock.

bitfield.description: Invert HSYNC

bitenum.description: Line clock pin is active high and inactive low.
Line clock pin is active low and inactive high.

bitfield.description: Invert VSYNC

bitenum.description: Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low.
Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high.

bitfield.description: AC bias pin transitions per interrupt Value (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC bias pin transitions

AC bias pin frequency Value (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the AC bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge buildup within the display.

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal. It is used for the third LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the third LCD

bitfield.description: Horizontal back porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display (program to value minus 1).

Horizontal front porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before the line clock is asserted (program to value minus 1).
Horizontal synchronization pulse width. Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal. It is used for the third LCD output. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period of the third LCD

bitfield.description: Vertical back porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame before the first set of pixels is output to the display
Vertical front porch. Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame

Vertical synchronization pulse width. In active mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods (program to value minus 1) to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode.

register.description: MFLAG thresholds for graphics pipeline. The synchronization event is defined based on the output using the pipeline: primary LCD, secondary LCD, TV output or write-back to the memory.
